title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: 2026 French municipal elections: The right and far right remain mostly divided
Six Nations: France only team left who can claim Grand Slam after crushing Wales
French 'ultra-left' behind killing of right-wing youth, says justice minister
subhead: The victim, identified only as Quentin, aged 23, had been hospitalized and placed into a coma on Thursday after being attacked in Lyon. Supporters said he was providing security at a protest against an appearance by Rima Hassan, a left-wing member of the European Parliament.

title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei: The twilight of a tyrant
subhead: Ali Khamenei, supreme leader of the Islamic Republic since 1989, has grown increasingly repressive as he appears unable to organize his own succession, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: The dragon reveals its thousand incarnations at Paris's Quai Branly Museum
subhead: The museum presents an extensive exhibition dedicated to the mythical creature, which has dominated the Chinese fantastic bestiary for millennia, in partnership with the National Palace Museum in Taipei.

title: South Korea's 'comfort women' take on the US military
subhead: For decades, thousands of South Korean women were forced into prostitution for the pleasure of American soldiers, with the support of the Seoul government. They are now seeking reparations.

In Munich, France and Germany present two visions for Europe while Rubio wants to 'build a new Western century'
subhead: Emmanuel Macron urged Europe on Friday to take pride in itself in the face of the Trump administration's repeated attacks. While highlighting European values, Friedrich Merz reiterated his commitment to the transatlantic relationship.

title: The Iranian protesters killed by regime gunfire on January 8
subhead: Sina Ashkbousi, Behrouz Mansouri, Mansoureh Heydari, Keyvan Moradi Mirani and Roubina Aminian were killed on the first day of protests against the Iranian regime. Their stories reflect both the diversity of the protest movement and the brutality of the crackdown.

title: One year after JD Vance's hostile speech against Europe in Munich, what remains?
subhead: On February 14, 2025, the US vice president made his debut on the international political stage before the Western diplomatic and military elite, delivering a speech of unprecedented hostility toward European governments. This marked a decisive moment in the rift between Europe and the US.
